reviews.text: My girlfriends and I just returned from a quick weekend getaway at Chetola after trying to find a nice resort in the NC mountains for some quality girl time (no spouses or kids) that was not already booked. We wanted it to have a spa component as relaxation was high on our list.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, accomodations and service need some work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrial on Friday night, we opted for an easy, casual dinner at the pub and were disappointed in both the service (there are only a handful of tables and no one noticed us) and the food. Stay away from the Fish and Chips and the Veggie Burger. We cancelled our reservation for dinner at the Manor House for Saturday night and opted for something in town - Bistro Roca - and it was outstanding! Make sure you have a meal there if you go. The service at the resort restaurant was worse the next morning at breakfast when the hostess was training and did not know anything about anything. We asked about the coffee bar that we saw advertisied in the elevator and she didn't know anything about it. Sunday morning at breakfast the hostess was so frazzled and rude that we turned around and left to go somewhere in town.
reviews.title: Our mountain headquarters

reviews.text: Unfortunately our room had a king sized bed and a queen pull-out sofa bed. Our friend who slept on the sofa bed was very uncomfortable so we requested a roll-away cot for the next night. They tried to charge us $10 until we explained that it was due to the poor quality of the sofa bed. The walls are very thin so you can hear everything that goes on in the hallway, next door and above you. Bring ear plugs. On the plus side, our view of the pond was really pretty, and we enjoyed sitting on the balcony.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the front desk and the concierge were incredibly helpful. One gave us advice on the hikes in the area and the concierge called the local coffee shop to see if they had chai tea (no Starbucks in the area + resort coffee bar does not open until 11 a.m.). Very friendly, accommodating and willing to help.
reviews.title: A beautiful property with some quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The massage appointments and the spa were nice. It definitely helped to relax us before lunch.
reviews.title: Don't Bother

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bob Timberlake Inn for 2 nights. We were greeted by our Innkeeper, "Pat", who was wonderful. She explained the history of the hotel and gave a tour. Our room looked over the lake where the swans stay. The Inn is very quiet and very beautiful. There is a pantry where you can get coffee, tea or ice cream any time of the day or night. They have turn down service and leave 2 warms cookies for you at night.
reviews.title: Wonderful, relaxing Inn

reviews.text: We ate at the hotel restaurant. The food was good but not great.
reviews.title: Typical rip off "resort"

reviews.text: It is a wonderful place to get away. It is close to the Blue Ridge Pkwy and Grandfather Mountain, which is another great place to see. Just be warned, the road to the top is very curvy with hairpin turns and switchbacks.
reviews.title: Best in the area, but....

reviews.text: Typical rip-off hotel: over-the-top lobby; pedestrian rooms. Our room had a severe dust mite problem as evidenced by my 36-hour sinus headache that was only relieved with massive doses of Motrin and Tylenol--which I had to purchase from the gift shop at $1 per packet of 2 pills.
reviews.title: Not the same

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bob Timberlake ads say every room has a jacuzzi and stocked snack bar. Say what??? False advertising in a big way.
reviews.title: Wonderful location and views

reviews.text: Exchanged my timeshare for a two bedroom/two bath condo at the Chetola Resort. In a nutshell everything was great. Great accommodations, great location (especially if you are skiing on Appalachian Mountain). Electronics in the unit were a little outdated but hey this isn't the place for you if you want to stay in and watch TV all day. Sugar, Beech, and Hawksnest aren't close by but none of them are more than 45 minutes away and Boone is only 10 minutes from the resort.
reviews.title: Two bedroom units were great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps the best place overall to exchange a timeshare in the area. Oh yeah, and free internet too!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience from beginning to end.
This resort is great but DO NOT rent a unit from Blowing Rock Resort Rentals!
reviews.text: We learned about Chetola through a referral for their Manor House restaurant from another lodging establishment. After encountering a terrible experience at another local bed and breakfast, we inquired about a room at the Bob Timberlake bed and breakfast at Chetola while dining at their wonderful Manor House restaurant. Fortunately, they were able to give us a room for the next evening and it was great. The staff know how to welcome you and cater to your wants and they do it superbly. The setting is absolutely beautiful and the accommodations are definitely top drawer. Everything was so very welcoming and comfortable, from the greeting at the desk, to the wine and cheese social, to the turn down service with cookies and then breakfast in bed the next day. Oh, and the jacuzzi was great as well.

We have stayed at Chetola a total of three times. Love the resort, great for couples or families. Lots to do on-site and close to great attractions, hiking, etc. The first two times we rented directly through the resort and never had a problem. Last summer we rented through Blowing Rock Resort Rentals, which I would never recommend to anyone. We checked in on a Sunday evening at 9pm and the unit hadn't been cleaned. Visibly soiled towels in bathrooms, no clean bedding, not a roll of toilet tissue. This for a condo unit we were paying $300+/night for. A cleaning company did come the next day at 1:30 in the afternoon. We requested less than one nights rental be refunded ($250.00) but Blowing Rock Resort Rentals refused and to this day have not compensated us to any degree. They were confrontational and very unprofessional in our dealings with them. I would highly recommend going elsewhere to rent anything in Blowing Rock.
reviews.title: Peaceful, romantic getaway!

reviews.text: Don't take any work/computer with you and truly relax! We stayed in one of the 1 bedroom condos, Wren #202. The building may be a little older, but it was perfect! Has a gas fireplace, kitchen, refrigerator, oven, dishwasher, microwave, all we could have needed. Sliding glass doors lead out to a nice size balcony with chairs, also has a door off of the bedroom to the balcony. It was so quiet, and this is a very busy time of year in Blowing Rock.There is a reserved parking place right in front of your door, convenient for loading and unloading. The condo is decorated with a rustic/bear theme. They had a precious "Hugs Bear By Ditz" on the bed! Perfect touch! And if you have a chance to eat Breakfast @ the Manor House, ask to sit @ one of "Jenn's" tables. She just makes you feel better being around her. She is one of the best waitresses we've ever had and we eat out a lot! Relax!
reviews.title: Great location for Grandfather mountain

reviews.text: I don't write too many of these. But this place really blew us away. I can't recall such consistently friendly service in all areas - and the best thing was it was very unintrusive, which I like. Nobody grabbed my bags to lead me to my room with their hands out, in other words.
reviews.title: Awesome enough to inspire a review.

reviews.text: Room was nice-sized but a fairly stock hotel room. Nice balcony, however, overlooking the lake. Quietude abounds due to great space/occupancy ratio. For a resort, an amazingly large number of great kids' activities available. We didn't even do the camps, just swimming, rowing, some July 4 special activities, playground.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: Didn't eat meals here except the paid-for breakfasts as my kids like more basic fare (Knights on Main is their "place"). Breakfasts were solid in quality, excellent in variety.
reviews.title: Beautiful environment - relaxing stay

reviews.text: What it was, above all, was serenity, calm, beauty without any drawbacks of note. The closest thing I can come up with as a negative is that it's a bit of a hike up into the downtown strip with young kids so we had to drive up - which I'd have rather not done and didn't have to do at some of the motels around town in the past. But that's the price I guess you pay to get a little further from it all.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Service was exceptional! I have 3 children under 4 and all staff was so helpful and accommodating. Food was a little disappointing, but not bad, just not as exceptional as staff and accommodations. Beautiful place. Beds were good, but the comforter was a little too warm for summer. I will definitely make a return visit. I highly recommend you try it.
reviews.title: 3300 acres of history at your backdoor...
